title: Make ICryptographyProvider interface and implementations more secure
author: magriggs
body_snippet:
ICryptographyProvider interface and implementations are not secure by design, nor by implementation. Re-design to keep exposure of plaintext secrets to a minimum.

## Expected Behavior
No persistent copies of plaintext/unencrypted secrets in memory. Any plaintext should be ephemeral, and explicitly zero-ed after use.

## Current Behavior
Plaintext copies of secrets are available in memory dumps of the application, from startup.
